sen.j: 柴田 彦三郎（しばた ひこさぶろう、天保11年（1840年） - 慶応2年6月23日 (旧暦)（1866年8月3日））は新選組平隊士。
sen.e: Hikozaburo SHIBATA (1840 - August 3, 1866), was a lowly member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 新選組→ the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate)としました。
sen.e: Hikozaburo SHIBATA (1840 - August 3, 1866), was a lowly member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Hikozaburo SHIBATA (1840 - August 3, 1866), was a lowly member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）10月、近藤勇の江戸での隊士募集に応じて上洛。
sen.e: November 1864 (表記の変更) he went up to Kyoto to apply for the recruitment carried out by Isami KONDO in Edo (Tokyo).
In November 1864, he went up to Kyoto to apply for the recruitment carried out by Isami KONDO in Edo (Tokyo).
sen.cmt: (表記の変更)を削除しました。In を追加しました。1864のあとにカンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 慶応2年2月に一橋家家臣原口某と名乗り勝手に金策をした。
sen.e: March 1866 (表記の変更), he raised money swindling with a false identity and name, a retainer of the Hitotsubashi family called a certain HARAGUCHI.
In March 1866, he raised money swindling with a false identity, a retainer of the Hitotsubashi family called a certain HARAGUCHI.

sen.j: 人相書を用意した松本喜次郎や近藤芳助など４人の隊士に追われ出雲の宿で役人に捕まり屯所へ戻され、大勢の隊士の前で切腹した。
sen.e: Tracked by four Shinsengumi members including Kijiro MATSUMOTO and Yoshisuke KONDO, who prepared his description, he was detained by officials at an inn in Izumo and transferred to the quarters, and he was obliged to commit ritual suicide by disembowelment in front of a lot of his colleagues.
sen.cmt: 屯所→定訳不明：quartersとしました。

He died at the age of 28.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.e: His grave was in Koen-ji Temple.
